results.title: Hunting
results.brief_description: The power of seduction is explored in this dramatic thriller where corruption is rife in the business and political world. Media tycoon Michael Bergman (John Savage) meets a married executive secretary (Kerry Armstrong) and the two begin an affair. She, seduced by promises and material wealth, falls for Michael and moves into his mansion and life for good. Once part of his domain, however, like a moth to the flame (a literal image in the film) her new world starts to unravel. Written, directed and produced by Frank Howson. Cast includes Guy Pearce, Rebecca Rigg, Jeffrey Thomas, Rhys McConnochie, Nicholas Bell.

results.title: Hunters of the Skies the Falcons
results.brief_description: This informative documentary looks at the six species of falcons found in Australia. Dramatic high-speed camera sequences capture the power and speed of the falcons in flight and during hunting. Despite their speed and power, survival for young falcons is still not an easy task. Approximately 70% of the young birds do not survive their first year.

results.title: Hunters of the seal: a time of change
results.creator_credit: Barbara Gullahorn-Holecek, Time-Life Films and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description: Contrasts the old and new ways of life of the Netsilik Eskimo. Shows how their conversion to Christianity and the efforts of the Canadian government to help them have put an end to their nomadic lifestyle. Narrated by Mercedes McCambridge. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Hunters of the North Pole
results.creator_credit: Nils Rasmussen, Donald Mulholland and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A glimpse of life as far north as it can be lived, with scenes of walrus, seal and polar-bear hunts. Taking us northward to Greenland, the camera records the year’s round for the Inuit of Thule. In the lengthening daylight of spring, they cross the sea ice by dog sled in quest of seal and polar bear, racing towards land with their catch as the ice bridge begins to melt and crack. When the autumn days shorten, the hunters, in final preparation for the months of Arctic night, set out in boats to harpoon walrus.

results.title: Hunters and collectors: the way to go out
results.creator_credit: Andrew de Groot, Julie Stone and Human Fraility
results.brief_description: Presents a compilation of film clips and live tracks featuring the work of the band The Hunters and collectors. The filmclips comprise: “Talking to a stranger”, “Lumps of lead”, “Judas sheep”. Live traks include “The Way to go out”, “The Slab”, “Throw your arms around me”, “I couldnt give it to you”, “Chalkie”, “The Umbeliever”, “Carry me”, “I believe”.

results.title: Hunter
results.brief_description: In this 2D hand-drawn animation The Hunter, the animator uses stereotypical images (remniscent of the 50’s hollywood animation)of a tribal African wandering through the desert in search of a party. Whilst wearing shoes made from coconuts the man puts a bucket on his head and is then shot by a hunter.

results.title: Hunt for the Wilderpeople
results.brief_description: Ricky is a defiant young city kid who finds himself on the run with his cantankerous foster uncle in the wild New Zealand bush. A national manhunt ensues, and the two are forced to put aside their differences and work together to survive.

constellations_other.name: Native Tongue
constellations_other.description: The lead single off her album of the same name, 'Native Tongue' saw artist Mo'Ju explore cultural identity through music, movement and striking visuals.

results.title: Hunt for a cancer killer
results.creator_credit: Harold Mayer, Michael Sklar and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: A graphic account of science’s determined search for a chemical cure for cancer, outlining the promising work being done in the field of antibiotics. Includes interviews with scientists and visits to scientific laboratories and hospitals where tests and experiments are being carried out to produce a cancer-killing compound without harming healthy tissues.

results.title: Hunt
results.creator_credit: David Deverell and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Short story showcase”.
A hunting trip turns into a deadly manhunt, touching on themes of man’s relationship to his environment, animals and other people. Adapted from a story by Richard Connell.

results.title: Hungry minds
results.brief_description: A documentary report of the intellectual starvation in countries ravaged by WWII. Schools are now lost in the rubble with homes, hospitals and churches; children gather knowledge of the world from the black markets and the refuse dumps, roving in gangs through the litter of civilisation. From mute faces, eyes stare hungrily, marking the desolation war has wrought in minds as well as bodies. It is here that a beginning must be made: textbooks, writing materials, research equipment, and a thousand other tools of knowledge are needed to break apathy and hostility, and to open young minds to the promise of a peaceful world.
